# The `MachineOutliner` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

An interprocedural pass which finds repeated sequences of instructions and replaces them with calls to functions. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

An interprocedural pass which finds repeated sequences of instructions and replaces them with calls to functions.

Each instruction is mapped to an unsigned integer and placed in a string. The resulting mapping is then placed in a <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/suffixtree">SuffixTree</a></code>. The <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/suffixtree">SuffixTree</a></code> is then repeatedly queried for repeated sequences of instructions. Each non-overlapping repeated sequence is then placed in its own <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a></code> and each instance is then replaced with a call to that function.

Definition at line 424 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.

### findCandidates() {#a9ffe567aa54e3a2cf09da0fda0b7782b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineOutliner::findCandidates (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/instructionmapper">InstructionMapper</a> &amp; Mapper, std::vector&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/outliner/outlinedfunction">OutlinedFunction</a> &gt; &gt; &amp; FunctionList)</>}>
Find all repeated substrings that satisfy the outlining cost model by constructing a suffix tree.

If a substring appears at least twice, then it must be represented by an internal node which appears in at least two suffixes. Each suffix is represented by a leaf node. To do this, we visit each internal node in the tree, using the leaf children of each internal node. If an internal node represents a beneficial substring, then we use each of its leaf children to find the locations of its substring.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Mapper">Contains outlining mapping information.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] FunctionList">Filled with a list of <code>OutlinedFunctions</code> each type of candidate.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp/#l00497">497</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### outline() {#a1ac412f2e4cc981d3b9d3f6cf6d5988a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MachineOutliner::outline (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp; M, std::vector&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/outliner/outlinedfunction">OutlinedFunction</a> &gt; &gt; &amp; FunctionList, <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/instructionmapper">InstructionMapper</a> &amp; Mapper, unsigned &amp; OutlinedFunctionNum)</>}>
Replace the sequences of instructions represented by <code>OutlinedFunctions</code> with calls to functions.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="M">The module we are outlining from.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="FunctionList">A list of functions to be inserted into the module.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Mapper">Contains the instruction mappings for the module.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] OutlinedFunctionNum">The outlined function number.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

## Public Member Attributes

### LocalHashTree {#ad7f0d14fbfba3488e48618a1aeb03372}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;OutlinedHashTree&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;MachineOutliner.cpp&#125;::MachineOutliner::LocalHashTree</>}>
This is a compact representation of hash sequences of outlined functions.

It is used when OutlinerMode = CGDataMode::Write. The resulting hash tree will be emitted into &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;outlined section which will be dead-stripped not going to the final binary. A post-process using llvm-cgdata, lld, or ThinLTO can merge them into a global oulined hash tree for the subsequent codegen.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp/#l00449">449</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp/#l00435">435</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.

### OutlinerMode {#ac926a3be74c8922d14e6bfae65b4d00c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>CGDataMode anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;MachineOutliner.cpp&#125;::MachineOutliner::OutlinerMode = CGDataMode::None</>}>
The mode of the outliner.

When is&#39;s CGDataMode::None, candidates are populated with the suffix tree within a module and outlined. When it&#39;s CGDataMode::Write, in addition to CGDataMode::None, the hash sequences of outlined functions are published into LocalHashTree. When it&#39;s CGDataMode::Read, candidates are populated with the global outlined hash tree that has been built by the previous codegen.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp/#l00458">458</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RunOnAllFunctions {#ad3998e6676cd05bb1150ba9b85a3a4b3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;MachineOutliner.cpp&#125;::MachineOutliner::RunOnAllFunctions = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a></>}>
Set to true if the outliner should run on all functions in the module considered safe for outlining.

Set to true by default for compatibility with llc&#39;s -run-pass option. Set when the pass is constructed in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetpassconfig">TargetPassConfig</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp/#l00441">441</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
